data.author: Mark Twain
data.quote: Humor is mankind's greatest blessing

data.author: Mark Twain
data.quote: When you fish for love, bait with your heart, not your brain

data.author: Mark Twain
data.quote: Don't go around saying the world owes you a living. The world owes you nothing. It was here first

data.author: Mark Twain
data.quote: Wrinkles should merely indicate where smiles have been

data.author: Mark Twain
data.quote: When in doubt, tell the truth

data.author: Stephen King
data.quote: He understood well enough how a man with a choice between pride and responsibility will almost always choose pride—if responsibility robs him of his manhood.

data.author: Theodore Roosevelt
data.quote: We do not admire the man of timid peace. We admire the man who embodies victorious effort; the man who never wrongs his neighbor, who is prompt to help a friend, but who has those virile qualities necessary to win in the stern strife of actual life.

data.author: Henri-Frédéric Amiel
data.quote: It is not what he has, or even what he does which expresses the worth of a man, but what he is.

data.author: Confucius
data.quote: The way of a superior man is three-fold: virtuous, he is free from anxieties; wise, he is free from perplexities; bold, he is free from fear.

data.author: Saul Bellow
data.quote: A man should be able to hear, and to bear, the worst that could be said of him.

data.author: Malcolm X
data.quote: Nobody can give you freedom. Nobody can give you equality or justice or anything. If you’re a man, you take it

data.author: Burl Ives
data.quote: To be a man requires that you accept everything life has to give you, beginning with your name

data.author: Rudyard Kipling
data.quote: Gardens are not made by singing 'Oh, how beautiful,' and sitting in the shade.

data.author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam
data.quote: Man needs his difficulties because they are necessary to enjoy success.

data.author: P.T. Barnum
data.quote: Fortune always favors the brave, and never helps a man who does not help himself.

data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
data.quote: A hero is no braver than an ordinary man, but he is brave five minutes longer.

data.author: Lucille Ball
data.quote: I'd rather regret the things I've done than regret the things I haven't done.

data.author: Dolly Parton
data.quote: We cannot direct the wind, but we can adjust the sails.

data.author: Jim Henson
data.quote: My hope still is to leave the world a bit better than when I got here.

data.author: Willie Nelson
data.quote: When I started counting my blessings, my whole life turned around.
